name: Lemoine's conjecture
rephrased: Every odd integer greater than 5 can be written as the sum of an odd prime and an even semiprime.
implication_form: If an odd integer is greater than 5, then it can be expressed as the sum of an odd prime and an even semiprime.
explained: Lemoine's conjecture, also known as Levy's conjecture, states that every odd integer greater than 5 can be expressed as the sum of an odd prime and an even semiprime.
